name: Seth Easter
headline: Senior Production Designer, ABC News & ABC Daytime · Emmy-winning Art Director · Experiential/Broadcast Environments
summary: American production designer and creative director best known for long-running work for ABC News and ABC Daytime, including the design of LED-forward, video-as-scenery, modular multi-show studios for the network’s Hudson Square facility, election-night headquarters, debate stages and special events. Art director on multiple Tony Awards broadcasts and part of the Emmy-winning team for the 65th Tony Awards broadcast. Skilled at delivering large, technology-heavy sets on immovable news and live-event timelines.

experience.title: Senior Production Designer, ABC News & ABC Daytime
highlights: Led scenic design through ABC’s migration to Disney’s Hudson Square complex, keeping visual identity consistent across flagship news and daytime shows.
Production designer on GMA Studio C (2025 rebuild) — loft-style, 187M-pixel LED environment with moving multipurpose walls and AR-ready layouts.
Spearheaded the Studio TV3 election-cycle overhaul (2020): wraparound LED, AR-capable, shareable between multiple ABC News shows.
Designed 2024 election-night environment with embedded touchscreens, presenter interactivity and re-envisioned desks.
Designed debate-stage treatment for ABC U.S. presidential coverage (dark, candidate-first scenic with integrated LED and typography).
Developed modular, video-heavy scenic language reused for smaller Hudson Square studios (WNN, GMA First Look, etc.).
Collaborated with lighting, AV/integration, graphics and editorial teams to deliver broadcast-ready spaces on fixed dates.

experience.title: Founder / Principal
highlights: Independent production-design practice focused on broadcast and live entertainment, political events and televised specials.
Known for bringing broadcast technologies (large LED, video floors, AR layouts) into entertainment-style productions.
Engaged for high-pressure events requiring fast scenic turnarounds.

experience.title: Art Director, Televised Events (Tony Awards broadcasts)
highlights: Art Director, 65th Tony Awards — broadcast won the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Art Direction for Variety or Nonfiction Programming; worked with Production Designer Steve Bass.
Art Director, 63rd Tony Awards — broadcast received Primetime Emmy nomination in same category.
Worked in large, multi-camera live entertainment broadcast workflows.
